topic: How to implement data pipelines using fastapi with Python 3.12+
prompt: Write a Python 3.12+ focused, accurate explainer for: How to implement data pipelines using fastapi with Python 3.12+

response_parsed.title: Implementing Data Pipelines Using FastAPI with Python 3.12+
response_parsed.summary: This guide demonstrates how to create efficient and scalable data pipelines using the modern web framework, FastAPI, in combination with Python 3.12+. We will cover key concepts, code examples, version notes, and caveats to ensure a comprehensive understanding.
key_points: Setting up data sources (SQL databases, APIs, etc.)
Designing data models with Python's Dataclasses and Pydantic
Implementing asynchronous functions for improved performance
Utilizing FastAPI plugins like FastAPI-SQLAlchemy for ORM capabilities
version_notes: Python 3.12+ is required for using new features like pattern matching
FastAPI v0.75+ is recommended for this tutorial
SQLAlchemy v2.0+ should be used with FastAPI-SQLAlchemy
caveats: Asynchronous functions can make the code more complex, requiring careful management of concurrency
FastAPI does not have built-in support for many databases. Additional packages (like SQLAlchemy) are needed.
Ensure your development environment is set up correctly to avoid issues with dependencies
